revised_title: Spectral Variation of Refractive Indices of Flame Soot
tldr: The authors determined the spectral variation of the refractive indices of flame soot by combining classical and dynamic light scattering measurements with the Kramers-Kronig relations. They used a premixed propane-oxygen flame and found that the technique they developed can yield accurate refractive indices of soot under flame conditions. This research is important for radiative transfer calculations and in situ oxidation and growth studies of soot particles.
